messages.message:
Hi People, we’ll be shipping the October release to BofA early tomorrow morning.  There are a few changes that might require us to hand hold them through them so would love to get a small excerpt on what setting I should enable, and what are the necessary pre-requisites that we need to follow to get the environment up and running:
• Flow Tasks in Database: We need to enable the environment flag and create a database @abhilash 
• HITL: @Eric Han @Jonathan Shih 
• Refiner with Jobs Table: @Erick is this going to go through in the release? 
• Boto3 upgrade: @achao 
• … Anything else that I might be missing? 
We will ask for a couple hours on Thursday to help and verify the installation.  We’ll let you know when the meeting is so that you can keep some cycles free to answer questions.
The flags for HITL are: `ENABLE_FLOW_PIPELINES` and `ENABLE_FLOW_REVIEW_V2`. First one is for pipelines backend and the second one is for the new UIs

Refiner with jobs table is in! No flags (job service flag would do the trick). Do we have any customers who aren’t using job service? I didn’t do as much testing with that and can do that beforehand if we have some with that flag off
No, we are going to start forcing people to use jobs table and task table from this release :slightly_smiling_face:

For upgrading bofa to boto3, we’ll need to make sure boto3 is pulling from their ca bundle properly. First they should deploy the configmap here https://github.com/instabase/deployments/blob/master/customers/baml/poc/configmaps/config via `oc create configmap aws-config --from-file=configmaps/config` ,  Then deploy file-tservice with `enable_s3_boto_config` set to be `true` . Happy to field questions thursday too!
